meanings.definition: To add to something that already exists.
meanings.sent1: I will superadd more sugar to the cake batter for extra sweetness.
meanings.sent2: She decided to superadd more details to her painting to make it more interesting.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to superadd glitter to the soup, but quickly realized it was a mistake.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm seemed to superadd energy to the whole team.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's feedback will superadd value to your project.

meanings.definition: To increase the quantity or quality of something.
meanings.sent1: We need to superadd more chairs to accommodate all the guests.
meanings.sent2: The company aims to superadd new features to their product to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: The magician attempted to superadd more rabbits to his hat, but they kept disappearing.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to superadd brightness to the room.
meanings.sent5: Adding fresh herbs will superadd flavor to the dish.
